pros: great place to work and employees are very caring

cons: Didn't feel like we were doing good work there. Leadership caused COVID breakout for entire staff by not adhering to their own policies.

pros: Clients are awesome. Some colleagues were awesome too
cons: One BCBA had it out for me from the get go, my concerns weren’t addressed. No accommodations were made for me while pregnant.

pros: -great way to learn about the. field of ABA
cons: takes advantage of staff, poor salary, dramatic work environment, admin staff don't care about you and make that clear, pizza partys and park days aren't enough incentive

pros: As a new employee I appreciate Firefly Autism's employee-centered engagement as it pertains to feedback, onboarding, and overall consistency with progressing the company forward for employees and clients. The admin is extremely supportive and transparent with company communication while leading with empathy.
cons: Technology could use a refresh. We've been informed this is something being looked at immediately.

pros:
-important mission
-friendly line staff and clinicians
-I don't really have anything else good to say other than that a pro is that if you haven't started working here yet, you still have time to avoid getting sucked in to the toxic "Firefly Family"
cons:
CEO more interested in personal glory/being at the center of the universe than the mission itself and very disconnected from the work of the organization

-they ask staff to "volunteer" on the weekends and while it's voluntary (as in unpaid) it's not really optional if you want to keep your job

job_title: Register Behavirial Tech (RBT) in Denver, CO
pros: Early childhood program is exceptional. Collaborative work environment, supportive network, great learning experience, and the kiddos are so rewarding to work with. Leadership in this program consistently asks for feedback and works to create team building activities to increase morale. If you like ABA, this is the place to do it. Paid holiday breaks and PSL.
cons: Unfortunately the pay is not enough for sustainable living in the area. Very difficult to support yourself financially. The company has certainly struggled with organization and maintaining consistency in employee evaluations (only opportunity for raises). Work is being done to improve this by a few individuals, however it needs to be a shift in overall mindset. There is also not enough time allocated for completion of administrative work which often leads to playing catch up at home. Turnover is a frequent occurrence.

review_title: Best Company I have ever worked for
pros: excellent training, great co-workers and supervision, great hours, great pay
cons: I cannot think of a single negative thing to say about Firefly!

pros: Wonderful leadership, quality therapy, strong Director of Home-Based services
cons: Low pay, long hours, unexperienced BCBA's, lack of professionalism

pros: Rewarding. Good coworkers. Opportunity to learn
The care provided to the clients is at the top of their field.
cons: Being expected to give more and more and then not being recognized for those efforts.
